business.headline: Tata Capital eyes India's biggest IPO, seeks $11 billion valuation: ReportLast week, Tata Capital's board approved the listing of up to 230 million shares, including an offer for sale by existing shareholders.

No-cost EMIs: The real cost behind 'zero interest' deals and who benefits? The idea of breaking down a large payment into smaller, interest-free instalments sounds attractive. However, there is more to these schemes than meets the eye.

Bitcoin up by 7%, Cardano jumps by 47% on Trump's US crypto reserves newsAs a result, on March 3, the total crypto market volume witnessed a jump of 197.62% from the previous day, and stood at $206.77 billion.

Paytm under ED lens for FEMA violations, gets Rs 611 crore noticeThe investigation agency said that Paytm failed to follow the rules under the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) while making an investment in Singapore.
IRCTC and IRFC get 'Navratna' status. Here's what it meansIRCTC has become the 25th Navratna among Central Public Sector Enterprises (CPSEs), while IRFC is now the 26th.
PF UPI withdrawal rules: How to withdraw EPF money via UPI To withdraw your PF money, it is essential to complete the KYC process for your EPF account.
Sensex, Nifty erase early gains to end flat in volatile tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 21,85 points to end at 73,176.25, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 5.40 points to close at 22,119.30.

Paytm shares recover after 4% drop on ED notice over FEMA violationsPaytm earlier informed stock exchanges that it had received a show cause notice from the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on February 28 at 7:27 PM. The notice, dated 27 February, was related to alleged violations of FEMA rules between 2015 and 2019.

Why has Radhika Gupta compared Nifty to Shah Rukh Khan? Details hereNifty has hit its longest losing streak in 29 years, wiping out Rs 90 lakh crore in investor wealth since hitting its peak in September. The Sensex has fallen over 12% since its September 2024 all-time high, when it touched its peak at 85,478.25.

Smallcap and midcap stocks are in free fall. What should investors do?The broader market saw heavy selling pressure last month, dragging the BSE Smallcap index down 15%—its first double-digit monthly decline since the pandemic sell-off—while the Nifty Midcap 100 fell over 10%.

India's manufacturing growth hits 14-month low in February on soft demandThe HSBC final India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index, compiled by S&P Global, fell to 56.3 in February - its lowest since December 2023 - from 57.7 in January. A preliminary estimate was much higher at 57.1.

Government looks to enhance PLI scheme to boost exports. Details hereIntroduced in April 2020, the PLI scheme has drawn substantial investment in 14 sectors, attracting original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and contract manufacturers to scale up production.

entertainment.headline: Blackpink's Lisa on her new album Alter Ego: Want people to feel empoweredLisa of Blackpink recently spoke about her new solo album, Alter Ego. In a virtual panel discussion, the singer shared her desire to make listeners feel empowered with her new album.

Taarak Mehta actor Deepti Sadhwani turns showstopper at Milan Fashion WeekTaarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah actor Deepti Sadhwani turned showstopper at Milan Fashion Week. The actor shared stunning photos from her rampwalk.

Kaam Idhar Udhar Hogaya: YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani on India's Got Latent rowYouTuber Ashish Chanchlani got emotional in his first video after his appearance on comedian Samay Raina's India's Got Latent show.

Maharani 4 teaser: Huma Qureshi returns as Rani Bharti to safeguard BiharActor Huma Qureshi is set to return as Rani Bharti in Maharani Season 4. The makers announced the news with the teaser of the upcoming gripping series.

TV show Tenali Rama set catches fire, shoot haltedA fire broke out on the set of TV show Tenali Rama due to a generator malfunction, halting production. There were no casualties, but the set suffered damage and repairs are underway.

Be Happy: Abhishek Bachchan reunites with Ludo co-actor Inayat in feel-good filmThe trailer of Abhishek Bachchan and Inayat Verma's upcoming dance-drama Be Happy was released today. Directed by Remo D'Souza, the heartfelt film will premiere on Prime Video on March 14.

BTS' J-hope's Seoul concert: New song, fan proposal and special appearance by JinBTS member and rapper J-hope recently held a concert in Seoul which was attended by his close friend and singer Kim Seokjin (Jin). The concert was one big event for the fans as it consisted of many other surprises besides the central performance by the artiste.

Khakee The Bengal Chapter: Jeet and Prosenjit announce release date with fun clipThe next installment of Netflix's critically acclaimed thriller series Khakee, Khakee: The Bengal Chapter will premiere on Netflix in March. The makers of the show announced its release date with a fun video.

Anupamaa actor Sudhanshu Pandey breaks silence on rumoured feud with Rupali GangulyActor Sudhanshu Pandey has addressed the ongoing rumours about a feud with his Anupamaa co-star Rupali Ganguly. In an interview, he clarified the situation and dismissed the speculations.

BRIT Awards 2025: Charli XCX wins album of the year, full winners list hereCharli XCX emerged as a major winner at the Brit Awards 2025, securing multiple accolades. Artists including Sabrina Carpenter and Billie Eilish also took home some of the biggest awards of the night.

Honey Singh's Millionaire Delhi concert: A night of nostalgia, iconic hitsHoney Singh's Delhi concert was packed with nostalgic hits, emotional tributes, surprise guests, and exclusive remixes. The rapper promised bigger things ahead as his Millionaire Tour continues.

Justin Bieber celebrates 31st birthday with family, shares rare pics of son JackPop sensation Justin Bieber marked his 31st birthday with a heartwarming family gathering. He shared rare photos with wife Hailey and their son Jack, capturing the joyous occasion.

general news.headline: Himani Narwal's 'friend' seen dragging suitcase in which her body was foundIn the CCTV footage that has emerged, accused Sachin could be seen dragging the suitcase through a deserted street on February 28.

Man dies by suicide, leaves behind clip saying girlfriend hid marriage from himIn his video, Abhishek Singh accused a woman of concealing her marriage while pursuing a relationship with him, while his brother alleged that she had extorted Rs 10-15 lakh from him.

Body shaming Rohit Sharma pathetic: Minister slams Congress, Trinamool leadersThe Sports Minister's sharp rebuke came hours after Mohamed called Rohit Sharma "fat for a sportsperson" and the "most unimpressive" captain in India's history. Saugata Roy said he completely agreed with her.
These oversmart people: Supreme Court warns Samay Raina over remarks in CanadaYouTuber Samay Raina had joked about the 'India's Got Latent' controversy during his show in Canada in February.

No one-size-fits-all in cricket: Do players need to fit the mould?Cricket has long accommodated players of all body types, with many stocky cricketers excelling at the highest level. Despite evolving fitness standards, the sport remains unique in its ability to embrace diverse physiques.

Bhagwant Mann got hyper during meet, walked out midway, allege Punjab farmersPunjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann walked out of a meeting with farmer leaders after a heated discussion, some farmer leaders alleged on Monday.

Padmakar Shivalkar, legendary Mumbai spinner, dies aged 84Padmakar Shivalkar, who was considered one of the best spinners to have never played for India, died due to age-related health issues on Monday, March 03.

Anushka Sharma bonds with Rohit Sharma's son at IND vs NZ match. WatchAnushka Sharma's video of playfully interacting with India captain Rohit Sharma and Ritika Sajdeh's son, Ahaan, has gone viral. The actor was present to cheer for Team India and her husband Virat Kohli at India vs New Zealand on March 2.

HAL's 3-week timeline ends, no breakthrough on fate of grounded Dhruv choppersA fleet of 300 Dhruv Advanced Light Helicopters (ALH) has been grounded since January after a crash, and defence experts have raised concerns about their operational reliability.

Guns, glamour and affair: What Himani Narwal's social media revealsTwo days after the body of young Congress activist Himani Narwal was discovered on a highway, India Today pieces together snippets of her life through her social media profile.

Rohit Sharma's bat does the talking. Cricket isn't a modelling contestCongress spokesperson Shama Mohamed fat-shaming Rohit Sharma and calling him an unimpressive captain shows her lack of understanding of the sport. Rohit's fitness, records, and leadership speak for themselves. Cricket isn't a modelling contest.
Forget the gowns, men's fashion was more fun at the Oscars 2025With bold brooches and unique ties, men's fashion took a playful turn at the Oscars 2025.

Why BSE, SEBI say new complaint against Madhabi Puri Buch is 'frivolous'SEBI and BSE said the complaint pertains to the listing of a company in 1994, and the officials named did not hold those capacities back then
One killed, many injured as car rams crowd in Germany's MannheimA car has driven into a crowd of people in the Western German city of Mannheim, killing one person and causing many casualties.

Row over Samajwadi leader's remark backing Aurangzeb, Eknath Shinde wants apologyMaharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde slammed Samajwadi Party MLA Abu Azmi for his remarks and said that he should be tried for treason.

Oscar 2025 full winners list: Best film Anora dominates 97th Academy AwardsThe 97th Academy Awards have wrapped up as of March 3 in EST (March 4 in IST). Sean Baker's Anora took home 5 top honours of the night including Best Picture and Best Actress.

Shahzadi Khan, UP woman on death row in UAE, was executed on Feb 15: GovernmentA 33-year-old woman from Banda, Uttar Pradesh, was sentenced to death in the UAE for the death of a four-month-old child under her care following a vaccination.

Zelenskyy breaks silence on Trump's public dressing-down: Don't think it's rightZelenskyy reiterated that he hopes to mend ties with Trump despite their tense Oval Office meeting, while making it clear that Ukraine won't cede territory to Russia.

Why a 50-year-old pact with Sri Lanka is being blamed for arrests of IndiansThe Indo-Sri Lankan Maritime Boundary Agreement of 1974, which drew an international maritime boundary between the two nations and ceded Katchatheevu Island to Colombo, is being referred to again. Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi questioned the pact's impact on India's territorial and fishing rights after fishermen in the state started an indefinite protest over the arrest of 32 of their colleagues by Sri Lanka.

Paracetamol during pregnancy linked to ADHD in childrenA new study found pregnant women who used acetaminophen, or paracetamol, later gave birth to children, more than three times as likely to receive an ADHD diagnosis.
Should 15-year-old vehicles be banned?Is it justified for the government to impose a mandatory ban on 15-year-old vehicles?

In Ranveer Allahbadia case, Supreme Court's big remark on content regulationThe Supreme Court directed the Centre to suggest some regulations for content on social media, but without impinging on the fundamental right of free speech and expression.

Reports claiming Rashmika's refusal to attend Bengaluru film festival false: Source	After Rashmika Mandanna faced criticism from a Congress MLA for allegedly skipping the Bengaluru International Film Festival, a source close to the actor dismissed the reports as 'false.'

The actor was present to cheer for Team India and her husband Virat Kohli at India vs New Zealand on March 2.

SRK looks dapper at Ashutosh Gowariker's son's wedding reception. WatchShah Rukh Khan was among the other actors to attend filmmaker Ashutosh Gowariker's son, Konark's wedding reception. A video of the actor from the event has gone viral.

Raveena Tandon, daughter Rasha Thadani's divine trip to Varanasi. PicsActor Raveena Tandon visited Varanasi with her daughter Rasha Thadani. The mother-daughter duo shared photos from the divine trip on social media.

sports.headline: Beth Mooney, bowlers star as Gujarat Giants thrash UP Warriorz by 81 runsGujarat Giants beat UP Warriorz by 81 runs in Match 15 of the Women's Premier League 2025 (WPL 2025). Beth Mooney was adjudged Player of the Match for her whirlwind innings of 96* (59).

I couldn't run 2 laps but could bat all day: Sunil Gavaskar on Rohit's fitness rowChampions Trophy 2025: Speaking to India Today, legendary Sunil Gavaskar revealed that he was unable to run two laps around the cricket ground during his playing days due to shin splints, arguing that cricket fitness and physical fitness can be two different things.

Steve Smith warns India of 'good aggression' from Travis Head Champions Trophy semi-final: Steve Smith, speaking to the press ahead of the game against India, said he is hopeful of another big show from Travis Head. Smith shed light on the nature of pitch in Dubai, but remained tight-lipped about whether Australia would play an extra specialist spinner.

Harbhajan Singh on Rohit Sharma fitness row: People with zero knowledge give sermonsFormer India cricketer Harbhajan Singh has extended support to Rohit Sharma amid the ongoing row over his fitness sparked by Congress National spokesperson Shama Mohamed.

Spin decisive but Australia not focusing just on Varun Chakravarthy: Steve SmithAustralia captain Steve Smith opened up about the threat posed by spinner Varun Chakravarthy ahead of their semi-final fixture against India in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Understandable why Indian fans are nervous before semis vs Australia: GavaskarChampions Trophy 2025: Speaking to India Today, batting great Sunil Gavaskar said India will not take Australia lightly despite the injury issues in the opposition camp. Gavaskar said India are more than capable of beating Steve Smith's men in the semi-final on Tuesday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
